column4: how do you mount a folder from your local machine so that it can be seen over a mixed(linux/windows) network?
you 'share' a directory or some how create a share. that the other machines then can access

but its best to learn how to config it by hand.
go try the beta of google chrome.
it works very well here. It has a great many extenesions.. and i can basically replace  my firefox setup with it now.
most of the fancy new stuff i hear went in 9.10 - Hopefully 10.04 will be a lot of polishing on it.
i noticed the write speed seeming slow also.. but the read speeds seem faster for my flash drives.. not sure what the deal ios
you are not being distracted by the windows copying file animations.. so it just seems longer. :)
